channel.title: New ideas
channel.description: So, I'm stuck. I can't gwd at the moment and barrows has gotten too boring, pking, not really my thing. I have 4m and a whip and a basic armor set. All my skilling stats are shit, but my combat stats are good. 99str/99attk/80defence:(/70prayer and 40 summoning[by tomorrow should have 52]. So my question is.. how should I make money? I kind of want to save for a pair of claws but 34m seems so far away. Any suggestions appreciated.

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

TheBeanie:

so 10 on maples and 5 on herbs… ill put 750k in chest to test how it all works and shiz

Check what time you put the cash in the coffers, then go back 24 hours later(no earlier)

Read full topic

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:27, topic:325271”][quote author=TheBeanie link=topic=421602.msg3098523#msg3098523 date=1263566436]
hmm might do that then… what do you guys reckon is best to put my workers on?
[/quote]
I do 10 workers on maples, and 5 on herbs. People will disagree with putting them on the maples but I only do it for the nests, which you get 8 of per day at 100% & >= 750k in coffers, which means you have the chance of getting high level seeds such as mage seeds which are 200k each. Whereas things like mining/fishing they’re pretty much a fixed outcome.[/quote]

even if you get terrible seeds from your nests, when crushed they are worth ~3kea anyway, you will usually get atleast one good seed though n_n

Read full topic

hmm might do that then… what do you guys reckon is best to put my workers on?

I do 10 workers on maples, and 5 on herbs. People will disagree with putting them on the maples but I only do it for the nests, which you get 8 of per day at 100% & >= 750k in coffers, which means you have the chance of getting high level seeds such as mage seeds which are 200k each. Whereas things like mining/fishing they’re pretty much a fixed outcome.

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

cows_be_sacred:

As in you lose 75k but you gain 150k I believe

This is what I was referring to. For the record, I imagine that you’ll do much better than just doubling your cash. You’ll probably make over 200k a day, which isn’t bad considering you only have to maintain a rating of 100 on Miscellania.

Read full topic

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:15, topic:325271”][quote author=maminerr link=topic=421602.msg3097251#msg3097251 date=1263433470]
you have too high standards.
i cant see why you cant go godwars.
Aviansies are your best bet to be honest.
when i got my account unbanned it had nothing,
i camped at aviansies all day and collected my kingdom management before i went to bed.
then i got a bgs and went god wars and invested some money in merching.
so in the end i was camping at bandos, merching and collecting kingdom management.
making money takes time unless you have ~100M to start with, be patient.
[/quote]

you have too high standards.
I agree with this.
but stop typing like this,
it looks horrible and is hard to read

“You have too high standards.” I agree with this, but can you please stop typing like above, it is nasty and hard to read! You seem to be typing out bullet points…[/quote]

why does it matter how i type? the words are all there. theyre all in sentences and ive answered the question and provided a solution.
im not seeing the problem, i think you need to get over it.

Read full topic

double my money? as in the 2m ?

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

TheBeanie:

so for example… if i put 2m in the coffers… how much will i make a day? if i have 100%

If you put 2m in then it will use 75k per day. Therefore you won’t have to add more cash until about 16 days later.
Ideally, you want to be able to get there daily. If you’ve done the second quest then you only need to mine one coal ore per day to keep the people 100% pleased with you; if you’ve unlocked fairy rings then this is easy enough, as there’s a fairy ring very close to the castle on Miscellania.
If you keep it at 100% each day then you should at the very least double your money each day. You’re likely to get more though.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

eczema3:

But maples have the best chance for the highest payout because of the seed nests that get given, you can get 200k+ just from 1 nest.

Half the time you just get crap though.

Read full topic

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:14, topic:325271”]The kingdom will take out 10%, or up to a maximum of 75k cash, from the coffers each day.
For maximum item output, you want them to be 100% satisfied with you as their king, and you want no less than 750k in the coffers at any time.
For the record, I don’t recommend putting workers on wood. Distribute workers across the farming and fishing for the best money.[/quote]
But maples have the best chance for the highest payout because of the seed nests that get given, you can get 200k+ just from 1 nest.

Read full topic

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

The kingdom will take out 10%, or up to a maximum of 75k cash, from the coffers each day.
For maximum item output, you want them to be 100% satisfied with you as their king, and you want no less than 750k in the coffers at any time.
For the record, I don’t recommend putting workers on wood. Distribute workers across the farming and fishing for the best money.

Read full topic

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

You need to assign the workers, and put money into the coffers. You can do this by talking to advisor Ghrim who is next to the king on miscellania

Read full topic

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:7, topic:325271”]Complete the quests throne of miscellania & royal trouble(if you haven’t already) and do the kingdom managing minigame. In the minigame you’re given 15 workers to do different tasks around the kingdoms of miscellania and etceteria, these tasks include chopping trees, farming herbs, fishing/cooking, mining and I think there’s something else… But anyway, every 24 hours from the time you put the cash into your ‘coffers’ (money pot for the kingdom) a stack of items get given to the kings advisor, the value of all these items are dependant on how much is in your coffers, I have about 3m in my coffers, and produce at the VERY MINIMUM 200k in items per day, my workers are 10 on maples, and 5 on herb collecting. The final produce comes to something around;

and once all the nests had been cleared etc, it came to this:

More / better info here: http://www.tip.it/runescape/?page=manage_thy_kingdom.htm

enjoy :)[/quote]

Hmm so thats the kingdom north of camelot right?

So if i put 3m in the chest thing they’ll produce more stuff? didnt know that lol

Read full topic

@maminerr wrote:

item.title: New ideas
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Complete the quests throne of miscellania & royal trouble(if you haven’t already) and do the kingdom managing minigame. In the minigame you’re given 15 workers to do different tasks around the kingdoms of miscellania and etceteria, these tasks include chopping trees, farming herbs, fishing/cooking, mining and I think there’s something else… But anyway, every 24 hours from the time you put the cash into your ‘coffers’ (money pot for the kingdom) a stack of items get given to the kings advisor, the value of all these items are dependant on how much is in your coffers, I have about 3m in my coffers, and produce at the VERY MINIMUM 200k in items per day, my workers are 10 on maples, and 5 on herb collecting. The final produce comes to something around;

and once all the nests had been cleared etc, it came to this:

More / better info here: http://www.tip.it/runescape/?page=manage_thy_kingdom.htm

enjoy
